review.title: A new type of judgement theorems for attribute characters in information system
review.abstract: The research of attribute characters in information system which contains core, necessary, unnecessary is a basic and important issue in attribute reduct. Many methods for the judgement of attribute characters are based on the relationship between the objects and attributes. In this paper, a new type of judgement theorems which are absolutely based on the relationship among attributes is proposed for the judgement of attribute characters. The method is through comparing the two new attribute sets $E(a)$ and $N(a)$ with respect to the designated attribute $a$ which is proposed in this paper. We conclude that which type of the attribute $a$ belongs to is determined by the relationship between $E(a)$ and $N(a)$ in essence. Secondly, more concise and clear results are given about the judgment of the attribute characters through analyzing the properties of refinement and precise-refinement between $E(a)$ and $N(a)$ in topology. In addition, the relationship among attributes are discussed which is useful for constructing a reduct in the last section of this paper. In the last, we propose a reduct algorithm based on $E(a)$, and this algorithm is an extended application of the analysis of attribute characters above.

metadata.title: A new type of judgement theorems for attribute characters in information system

sections.text: ar Xiv: 130 3.33 19v1 [cs.DS] 1The exploration of attribute signs in the information system that contain core, necessary, unnecessary, is a fundamental and important question in the reduction of attributes. Many methods of evaluating attribute signs are based on the relationship between the objects and attributes. In this paper, a new type of evaluation theory is proposed that is absolutely based on the relationship between attributes. The method is based on the comparison of the two new attribute sets E (a) and N (a) in relation to the attribute proposed in this paper. We conclude that the type of attribute to which an attribute belongs is essentially determined by the relationship between E (a) and N (a). Secondly, more precise and clearer results about the evaluation of attribute characters are given by analyzing the properties of attribute characters a.

sections.heading: 2.1. Pawlak’s rough set
sections.text: The rough set theory, proposed by Pawlak, provides a useful approach to dealing with dramatic data. In classical rough set theory, the data is divided into some equivalence classes. (Approximate space) Let U be a non-empty and finite set, and R an equivalence relationship to U, i.e. R is reflexive, symmetrical, and transitive. The ordered pair (U, R) is called approximation space. In an approximation space (U, R), R thus generates a partition U / R = {X1, X2,..., Xm} on U, where X1, X2,..., Xm are the equivalence classes indicated by the equivalence relationship R. In a rough formula, a pair of approximation operators is used to describe the objects. In the following definition, a pair of approximation operators is introduced, which are widely used. (Approximation operators) Do not let U have an infinite and empty relationship to each other.

sections.heading: 5. The relationship among attributes
sections.text: In this section, we will establish the relationship between attributes and attributes B (B) and B (B) between attributes B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B, B, B, B, B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B (B), B (B), B (B), B (B (B), B (B), B (), B (B (B), B (), B (B (B), B (), B (), B (B (B (B), B (), B (), B (B (), B (B), B (), B (), B (B (), B (, B (), B (B (), B (B (), B (), B (), B (B (), B (), B (, B (), B (), B (, B (), B (), B (), B (, B (), B (), B (, B (), B (), B (), B (), B (, B (), B (,

sections.heading: 7. Conclusion
sections.text: The reduction of attributes is a NP-hard problem, many methods are proposed to find all reductions or a single reduction, but there are not the optimal solutions for it, so it is still a problem that is worth exploring intensively. To some extent, the construction of a reduction is based on the relationship between attributes. In this essay, we give the substantial conclusions of the attribute character in terms of the relationship between attributes. We point out that the attribute, whether unnecessary or relatively necessary, is determined by the relationship between E (a) and N (a) in virtual form, and whether it is unnecessary or relatively necessary in terms of a reduction, is determined by the relationship of this reduction, E (a) and N (a). In addition, we give a simple and clear description of the characteristics of attributes in topology. In addition, some relationships between attributes are given and this is helpful for the construction of reductions. Finally, a method of reduction is given by attributes on the basis of E (a).

metadata.abstractText: The research of attribute characters in information system which contains core, necessary, unnecessary is a basic and important issue in attribute reduct. Many methods for the judgement of attribute characters are based on the relationship between the objects and attributes. In this paper, a new type of judgement theorems which are absolutely based on the relationship among attributes is proposed for the judgement of attribute characters. The method is through comparing the two new attribute sets E(a) and N(a) with respect to the designated attribute a which is proposed in this paper. We conclude that which type of the attribute a belongs to is determined by the relationship between E(a) and N(a) in essence. Secondly, more concise and clear results are given about the judgment of the attribute characters through analyzing the properties of refinement and precise-refinement between E(a) andN(a) in topology. In addition, the relationship among attributes are discussed which is useful for constructing a reduct in the last section of this paper. In the last, we propose a reduct algorithm based on E(a), and this algorithm is an extended application of the analysis of attribute characters above.
